result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Sawyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas J Sawyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas J Sawyer was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to submit DNA Sample, Count 2 dismissed

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

Defendant Nicholas J Sawyer in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, Court sentences defendant to: $673.50 fine/costs, defendant to submit DNA Sample

Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sarbacker requested a new plea/sentencing date before the jury trial.  State had no objection.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Jury trial on November 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared for defendant. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant stood mute, Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
